framework: QIF (Quantum Indeterministic Framework for Neural Security)

tactics.name: Neural Scan
tactics.description: Profiling neural signals, mapping BCI topology, fingerprinting devices and neural activity patterns.

tactics.name: BCI Intrusion
tactics.description: Gaining initial access to a BCI system or neural pathway via electrodes, RF, firmware, or supply chain.

tactics.name: Neural Injection
tactics.description: Injecting malicious signals at the electrode-tissue boundary or into the BCI data pipeline.

tactics.name: Cognitive Imprinting
tactics.description: Maintaining foothold across BCI sessions via calibration poisoning, learned neural patterns, or memory implants.

tactics.name: BCI Evasion
tactics.description: Avoiding detection by QI coherence metrics, anomaly detectors, and safety mechanisms.

tactics.name: Data Harvest
tactics.description: Harvesting neural data, cognitive states, memory patterns, ERP responses, and biometric signatures.

tactics.name: Physiological Disruption
tactics.description: Disrupting neural function, causing physical harm, denying BCI service, or weaponizing motor output.

tactics.name: Neural Modulation
tactics.description: Direct neural state modification via stimulation, entrainment, or signal injection. No traditional cybersecurity equivalent.

tactics.name: Cognitive Exploitation
tactics.description: Exploiting cognitive processes including memory, attention, identity, and agency. No traditional cybersecurity equivalent.

tactics.name: Energy Radiation
tactics.description: EM/RF attacks on neural tissue or BCI hardware via frequency-domain coupling. No traditional cybersecurity equivalent.

tactics.name: Model Subversion
tactics.description: Attacking BCI decoder/classifier models via poisoning, backdoors, adversarial inputs, or gradient leakage.

techniques.notes: Inject crafted signals mimicking legitimate brain activity at electrode-tissue boundary. Classical detection via impedance anomaly. QI coherence metric flags phase/timing inconsistency.

tara.mechanism: Electrical current delivery at electrode-tissue interface modulating local field potentials

clinical.therapeutic_analog: tDCS/tACS neuromodulation
clinical.safe_parameters: 1-2 mA, 20-30 min sessions, 35 cm² electrode area

governance.safety_ceiling: 2 mA current, 30 min/session, 7 sessions/week max

engineering.detection: Impedance anomaly detection, waveform verification, current leakage monitoring

techniques.notes: Disrupt or lock neural function via stimulation manipulation. Closed-loop devices (RNS, DBS) most vulnerable. QI detects anomalous coherence collapse. Distinct from Neural DoS: ransomware implies conditional restoration.

tara.mechanism: Disruption or conditional locking of neural function via closed-loop stimulation parameter manipulation

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Deep brain stimulation (DBS) / Responsive neurostimulation (RNS)
clinical.safe_parameters: Device-specific (Medtronic, NeuroPace): 1-5V, 60-450μs pulse width, 130-185 Hz

governance.safety_ceiling: Device-specific FDA-approved parameters, fail-safe shutoff mandatory

engineering.detection: Stimulation parameter monitoring, impedance trending, battery state tracking

techniques.notes: Passive interception of neural signals. At I0: quantum measurement disturbs state (detectable). At S1-S3: classical RF interception, most consumer BCIs transmit unencrypted. Merges ONI-T001 (Signal Profiling), ONI-T023 (Unencrypted Data Interception).

tara.mechanism: Passive capture of neural electromagnetic emissions from BCI data pathways

clinical.therapeutic_analog: EEG/ECoG diagnostic monitoring
clinical.safe_parameters: Non-invasive; passive recording only; no stimulation

governance.safety_ceiling: Passive recording; data retention and access controls are primary safety concern

engineering.detection: RF spectrum monitoring, cable shielding verification, encryption validation

techniques.notes: Intercept and modify signals at I0 boundary or BCI telemetry. No-cloning theorem prevents perfect copy of quantum neural states. Bell test detects entanglement disruption.

tara.mechanism: Active interception and modification of signals between BCI components in transit

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Signal routing in closed-loop neuroprosthetics
clinical.safe_parameters: Signal fidelity >99.9%, latency <10ms, bidirectional verification

governance.safety_ceiling: Signal integrity verification mandatory; fail-open to safe state

engineering.detection: End-to-end latency monitoring, cryptographic integrity checks, signal fingerprinting

techniques.notes: Exploit ion channel quantum tunneling to inject false synaptic events. Detectable via Q_tunnel term anomaly in QI equation. Requires understanding of target's ion channel tunneling profile.

tara.mechanism: Exploitation of quantum tunneling effects at nanoscale electrode-tissue junctions

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Quantum sensing for neural diagnostics (NV-center magnetometry)
clinical.safe_parameters: Passive quantum sensing; no stimulation; sub-nT field measurement

governance.safety_ceiling: Quantum sensing is passive; data sensitivity is primary concern

engineering.detection: Tunneling current anomaly detection, junction impedance spectroscopy

techniques.notes: THz stimulation triggers Davydov solitons in SNARE protein complexes, causing false neurotransmitter release at I0. Exploits energy transport in alpha-helix protein structures.

tara.mechanism: Davydov soliton propagation in protein alpha-helices at electrode-tissue interface

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Biophoton/soliton-based cellular signaling research
clinical.safe_parameters: No established parameters; theoretical mechanism

governance.safety_ceiling: Theoretical; no safe parameters established

engineering.detection: Infrared absorption spectroscopy, protein conformational monitoring

techniques.notes: Exploit weaknesses in BCI data protocols to inject commands or alter data formatting, bypassing security controls. Targets the digital decoding/telemetry pipeline.

tara.mechanism: Manipulation of BCI communication protocol handshakes, headers, or sequencing

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Adaptive stimulation protocol adjustment in closed-loop BCIs
clinical.safe_parameters: Protocol changes within FDA-cleared parameter envelope only
sources: Little et al. 2013 (Ann Neurol, adaptive DBS)

governance.safety_ceiling: Protocol modifications logged and bounded by device safety envelope

engineering.detection: Protocol conformance testing, sequence number validation, timing analysis

techniques.notes: Intercept and modify motor commands or cognitive instructions in transit through the BCI system. Targets closed-loop stimulation devices. Intent verification detects command-intent mismatch.

tara.mechanism: Interception and substitution of BCI motor/sensory command signals

clinical.therapeutic_analog: BCI command interfaces for motor-impaired patients
clinical.safe_parameters: Command verification with user confirmation; rate-limited actions

governance.safety_ceiling: Motor commands rate-limited; emergency stop always available

engineering.detection: Command pattern anomaly detection, user intent verification, behavioral consistency checks

techniques.notes: Inject RF signals calibrated to neural frequencies through BCI's own antenna or nearby transmitter. Synthetic brainwave patterns bypass analog front-end filters designed for biological signals.

tara.mechanism: Radiofrequency emission at neural oscillation frequencies to induce false brain activity patterns

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS)
clinical.safe_parameters: FDA-cleared: 10-20 Hz, 120% motor threshold, specific coil placements

governance.safety_ceiling: 120% motor threshold, site-specific protocols, operator certification required

engineering.detection: RF spectrum analysis, field strength monitoring, EEG artifact detection

techniques.notes: 3-76 Hz government-restricted. IS neural frequency. Penetrates globally. Direct gamma/alpha/theta cortical entrainment. US Navy operated at 76 Hz (Clam Lake) and 45 Hz (Republic). Russia, China maintain capability.

tara.mechanism: Extremely low frequency electromagnetic fields entraining endogenous neural oscillations via resonance

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Audio-visual entrainment (AVE) / photic driving therapy
clinical.safe_parameters: 0.5-40 Hz, non-contact, sub-threshold field intensity

governance.safety_ceiling: Photosensitive epilepsy screening required; frequency restrictions near 15-25 Hz

engineering.detection: EEG phase-locking analysis, spectral power monitoring at stimulation frequency

techniques.notes: UHF-Mil (225-400 MHz) + MICS (402 MHz) = neural-range beat frequency. BCI's own telemetry signal becomes part of the attack. 398 MHz mil + 402 MHz BCI = 4 Hz theta. Most dangerous coupling mechanism. QI CANNOT detect from signal data alone -- requires resonance shield.

tara.mechanism: Nonlinear mixing of two or more carrier frequencies in neural tissue producing intermodulation products at neural frequencies

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Temporal interference (TI) deep brain stimulation
clinical.safe_parameters: Two carriers at kHz range, difference frequency 1-100 Hz, <2 mA per channel

governance.safety_ceiling: Per-channel current <2 mA; carriers must not independently stimulate

engineering.detection: Spectral analysis for unexpected intermodulation products, dual-frequency monitoring

techniques.notes: S-band (2-4 GHz) pulsed microwave. Thermoelastic expansion causes cochlea to perceive as sound. Havana Syndrome model. PRF selects neural target: 40 Hz gamma, 10 Hz alpha, 4 Hz theta, 1 Hz delta.

tara.mechanism: Pulsed microwave radiation inducing thermoelastic expansion in neural tissue (Frey effect / microwave auditory effect)

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Transcranial microwave stimulation (experimental)
conditions: research tool for non-invasive deep stimulation
clinical.safe_parameters: No established clinical parameters; IEEE C95.1 exposure limits
sources: Lin & Wang 2007 (IEEE Trans Microw Theory Tech)

governance.safety_ceiling: IEEE C95.1 SAR limits: 1.6 W/kg (head), no therapeutic protocol established

engineering.detection: RF power density monitoring, thermal imaging, SAR dosimetry

techniques.notes: Two kHz+ signals create neural-range beat frequency at tissue intersection. Can target deep brain structures non-invasively. Licensed frequencies -- lower barrier than restricted.

tara.mechanism: Two high-frequency currents intersecting in deep brain tissue, with stimulation occurring only at the interference zone

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Temporal interference (TI) non-invasive deep brain stimulation
clinical.safe_parameters: Carriers >1 kHz, difference frequency at therapeutic target, <2 mA per electrode pair

governance.safety_ceiling: <2 mA per channel; computational targeting model required; real-time monitoring

engineering.detection: Finite element modeling validation, EEG monitoring of entrainment at target frequency

techniques.notes: Any carrier frequency modulated at neural frequency. Tissue demodulates the envelope. Stealth: carrier looks normal, attack is in the modulation. Lowest barrier to entry (PUBLIC access). tACS therapeutic principle weaponized.

tara.mechanism: Amplitude-modulated carrier signal where neural tissue demodulates the envelope at biologically active frequencies

clinical.therapeutic_analog: tACS with carrier-envelope paradigm
clinical.safe_parameters: Carrier >500 Hz, envelope 0.5-40 Hz, total current <2 mA

governance.safety_ceiling: Carrier analysis mandatory; modulation depth monitoring; total current <2 mA

engineering.detection: Demodulation analysis of all incident signals; envelope frequency extraction

techniques.notes: mm-wave/ADS (95 GHz) directed energy. Excites water molecules in top 0.4mm of skin. For surface implants: electrode heating, tissue damage at I0 boundary. Destroys interface integrity. Nation-state only.

tara.mechanism: Focused electromagnetic energy causing thermal damage to electrode-tissue interface or neural tissue

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Thermal ablation (stereotactic radiosurgery, LITT, RF ablation)
clinical.safe_parameters: MRI-guided, temperature-monitored, target-specific (<3mm precision)

governance.safety_ceiling: Real-time thermal monitoring mandatory; automatic shutoff at temperature threshold

engineering.detection: Tissue temperature monitoring, impedance changes, thermal imaging

sources: Zhang et al. 2024 (Professor X attack on EEG models)
techniques.notes: Backdoor injected during BCI decoder training. Trigger pattern in EEG input activates attacker-chosen output. Model performs normally on clean inputs. Demonstrated on P300, MI, SSVEP paradigms.

tara.mechanism: Backdoor insertion during BCI model training phase via poisoned training data or modified training process

governance.safety_ceiling: Model provenance verification; training data auditing; backdoor scanning

engineering.detection: Neural Cleanse, activation clustering, spectral signature analysis of model weights

techniques.notes: Backdoor persists through transfer learning from pre-trained BCI models. Attacker poisons upstream model, downstream users inherit the backdoor. Common in EEG foundation model paradigm.

tara.mechanism: Backdoor propagation via transfer learning from compromised pre-trained BCI model

governance.safety_ceiling: Pre-trained model provenance verification; fine-tuning validation

engineering.detection: Model diff analysis, behavioral testing on known inputs, weight distribution analysis

techniques.notes: Craft minimal perturbations that pass through BCI analog/digital filters but flip decoder output. Exploits gap between what filters remove and what classifiers rely on.

tara.mechanism: Crafted input perturbations that pass through BCI signal filters to reach decoder/classifier

governance.safety_ceiling: Adversarial robustness testing mandatory before deployment

engineering.detection: Input validation, filter integrity monitoring, adversarial example detection

techniques.notes: Single perturbation pattern that fools BCI decoder regardless of input. Works across subjects and sessions. Pre-computed offline, applied in real-time. Lower sophistication than targeted attacks.

tara.mechanism: Single perturbation vector effective against any input sample to a BCI classifier

governance.safety_ceiling: UAP scanning in deployment; input diversity requirements

engineering.detection: UAP detection via input preprocessing, certified defense bounds

techniques.notes: Determine if a specific person's neural data was used to train a BCI model. Reveals participation in clinical trials, neurological conditions. GDPR Article 9 implications.

tara.mechanism: Statistical inference to determine if specific neural data was used in BCI model training

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Clinical trial participation verification
clinical.safe_parameters: Privacy-preserving machine learning; differential privacy guarantees

governance.safety_ceiling: Differential privacy ε<1 for neural training data

engineering.detection: Differential privacy enforcement, membership inference testing, audit logging

techniques.notes: Reconstruct individual neural data from shared gradients in federated BCI training. Multi-site clinical trials share model updates. Gradient inversion recovers raw EEG with high fidelity.

tara.mechanism: Reconstruction of individual neural data from shared gradient updates in federated BCI training

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Federated learning for multi-site clinical BCI trials
conditions: collaborative model training without data sharing
clinical.safe_parameters: Secure aggregation; gradient compression; differential privacy on updates

governance.safety_ceiling: Gradient perturbation mandatory; secure aggregation protocol required

engineering.detection: Gradient norm clipping, secure aggregation verification, reconstruction testing

techniques.notes: Manipulate neurofeedback display or stimulation parameters in closed-loop BCIs. User adapts brain state to false feedback, causing maladaptive neuroplasticity. Therapeutic BCIs (ADHD, depression) most vulnerable.

tara.mechanism: Falsification of neurofeedback display or stimulation in closed-loop therapeutic BCIs

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Neurofeedback therapy
clinical.safe_parameters: Real-time signal verification; display integrity checks; patient outcome monitoring

governance.safety_ceiling: Neurofeedback display integrity verification; session outcome tracking; clinician oversight

engineering.detection: Feedback-signal correlation verification, display integrity hashing, outcome trend analysis

techniques.notes: Small adversarial perturbation injected into closed-loop BCI amplifies through feedback cycle. Each loop iteration increases deviation until system destabilizes. NeuroPace RNS, DBS with LFP sensing vulnerable.

tara.mechanism: Cascading perturbation in closed-loop stimulation systems where output feeds back as input

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Closed-loop responsive neurostimulation (RNS)
clinical.safe_parameters: Bounded stimulation parameters; gain limits; emergency shutoff

governance.safety_ceiling: Feedback gain limits; maximum stimulation bounds; automatic cascade detection and halt

engineering.detection: Loop gain monitoring, oscillation detection, stimulation parameter trending

sources: Biggio et al. 2012; Goldblum et al. 2022
techniques.notes: Subtly contaminate BCI training datasets to introduce systematic bias or weakness without creating a specific trigger (distinct from backdoor T2201). Degraded model performance appears as natural noise. Federated learning and crowd-sourced calibration data are vulnerable entry points.

tara.mechanism: Systematic bias injection into BCI training datasets to skew model behavior

governance.safety_ceiling: Training data provenance tracking; bias testing; diverse validation sets

engineering.detection: Data provenance verification, bias metrics, cross-validation with independent data

techniques.notes: Overwhelm targeted neurons via continuous high-frequency stimulation through compromised electrodes. Prevents normal neural signaling. Analogous to radio jamming. Implanted BCIs with stimulation capability.

tara.mechanism: Broadband electromagnetic interference overwhelming neural signal acquisition

clinical.therapeutic_analog: TMS (cortical suppression / virtual lesion technique)
clinical.safe_parameters: Single-pulse TMS for mapping; rTMS safety guidelines (Rossi et al. 2009)

governance.safety_ceiling: Single-pulse: generally safe; repetitive: requires seizure screening; motor threshold calibration

engineering.detection: RF spectrum monitoring, signal-to-noise trending, artifact detection algorithms

techniques.notes: Flood neural tissue with maximum stimulation across all available electrodes simultaneously. Unlike jamming (targeted), flooding is broad-area saturation. Can trigger seizures. Emergency shutoff required.

tara.mechanism: Excessive stimulation current overwhelming normal neural firing patterns

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT)
clinical.safe_parameters: Anesthesia required; seizure threshold titration; bitemporal/right unilateral placement

governance.safety_ceiling: Administered under anesthesia only; seizure monitoring; cognitive testing pre/post

engineering.detection: Current overload monitoring, seizure detection, post-stimulation EEG assessment

techniques.notes: Systematically probe neural tissue via low-amplitude stimulation pulses to map functional connectivity, identify responsive regions, and characterize individual neural signatures. Prerequisite for targeted attacks.

tara.mechanism: Systematic probing of neural response patterns to map BCI topology and individual neural architecture

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Brain mapping for surgical planning / functional localization
clinical.safe_parameters: Non-invasive fMRI/EEG; or intraoperative cortical stimulation with safety limits

governance.safety_ceiling: Passive mapping: no limits; active probing: stimulation safety protocols

engineering.detection: Probe pattern recognition, scan rate monitoring, unauthorized stimulation detection

techniques.notes: Compromised BCI firmware selectively drops or forwards neural signals based on content. Filter out specific cognitive states while passing others. Subtle censorship of neural output.

tara.mechanism: Selective forwarding or dropping of specific neural signal types in a multi-channel BCI pipeline

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Selective neural signal routing in closed-loop therapy
clinical.safe_parameters: Channel-specific filtering with integrity monitoring
sources: Stanslaski et al. 2012 (IEEE TBME, Medtronic sensing)

governance.safety_ceiling: All dropped/modified channels logged; signal integrity verification

engineering.detection: Channel dropout monitoring, signal completeness verification, forwarding consistency checks

techniques.notes: Overwhelm neural pathways with excessive stimulation or signal flooding causing temporary dysfunction or distress. Rate limiting at I0 and emergency shutdown are primary defenses.

tara.mechanism: Sustained high-rate stimulation exceeding neural tissue recovery capacity

clinical.therapeutic_analog: High-frequency stimulation for neural suppression (DBS at >100 Hz)
clinical.safe_parameters: 130-185 Hz, charge-balanced, within pulse generator safety envelope

governance.safety_ceiling: Charge-balanced waveforms mandatory; total charge per phase limited; duty cycle constraints

engineering.detection: Charge density monitoring, tissue impedance trending, stimulation artifact analysis

techniques.notes: Force involuntary motor actions by injecting false motor commands through compromised BCI motor interfaces. Intent verification compares commands against detected cognitive intent. Physical safety interlocks required.

tara.mechanism: Hijacking motor cortex output signals to produce involuntary movement via BCI motor interface

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Functional electrical stimulation (FES) / brain-controlled prosthetics
clinical.safe_parameters: User-initiated; emergency stop; force/speed limits; range of motion constraints

governance.safety_ceiling: Emergency stop always accessible; motor output force-limited; user confirmation for novel actions

engineering.detection: Intent verification, movement trajectory analysis, force/torque monitoring

techniques.notes: Force BCI processor to perform computationally expensive tasks (e.g., continuous high-rate sampling, unnecessary ML inference) to drain battery faster than normal. Critical for implanted BCIs where battery replacement requires surgery. Wearable BCIs also affected during critical use periods.

tara.mechanism: Accelerated battery depletion of implanted BCI through sustained high-power operation

governance.safety_ceiling: Battery state monitoring; low-power mode enforcement; surgical replacement scheduling

engineering.detection: Battery drain rate monitoring, power consumption anomaly detection

techniques.notes: Replicate user's neural signature to bypass BCI authentication. Classical biometrics (ERP templates, brainprint) are partially spoofable. If quantum neural signatures exist, no-cloning makes them physically unclonable.

tara.mechanism: Replication or synthesis of individual neural biometric signatures to impersonate BCI users

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Neural biometric authentication for medical device access
clinical.safe_parameters: Multi-factor neural authentication; liveness detection; template protection

governance.safety_ceiling: Biometric template encryption; revocation capability; anti-spoofing validation

engineering.detection: Liveness detection, presentation attack detection, template freshness verification

techniques.notes: Long-term subtle manipulation of cognitive patterns leading to gradual personality changes or identity confusion. Targets L14 (Identity/Cognitive Sovereignty). Detectable via longitudinal QI baseline comparison. Neurorights: psychological continuity.

tara.mechanism: Gradual modification of personality-linked neural patterns through sustained BCI-mediated influence

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Neuroplasticity-based rehabilitation / personality change monitoring in DBS
clinical.safe_parameters: Personality assessment battery pre/post; ethics review; patient autonomy safeguards

governance.safety_ceiling: Mandatory personality assessment; patient-reported autonomy measures; ethics board oversight

engineering.detection: Longitudinal personality metric tracking, behavioral change detection, patient self-report

techniques.notes: Inject false information into working memory circuits via targeted hippocampal/PFC stimulation. User perceives false memories or corrupted working memory contents as genuine. Closed-loop memory BCIs most vulnerable.

tara.mechanism: Targeted disruption of working memory maintenance via interference with sustained neural oscillations

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Working memory training / tDCS-enhanced cognitive training
clinical.safe_parameters: Theta-frequency tACS (4-8 Hz) over DLPFC; 1-2 mA; 20 min

governance.safety_ceiling: Cognitive assessment pre/post; no stimulation during critical tasks; informed consent for cognitive effects

engineering.detection: Working memory performance monitoring, theta power spectral analysis, sustained activity tracking

techniques.notes: Present stimuli designed to elicit P300 ERP responses revealing private knowledge (PINs, faces, locations). BCI app stores could embed interrogation stimuli in games. Demonstrated on consumer EEG (EMOTIV, NeuroSky).

tara.mechanism: Extraction of private information via P300 event-related potential responses to probe stimuli

clinical.therapeutic_analog: P300 BCI (communication for locked-in patients)
clinical.safe_parameters: Patient-initiated; consent per session; data encryption

governance.safety_ceiling: Stimulus content disclosed; session recording consent; no covert probing

engineering.detection: Stimulus audit logging, P300 amplitude monitoring, unauthorized stimulus detection

techniques.notes: Decode inner speech from neural signals without user consent. High-density arrays (Neuralink, Utah) approach word-level accuracy. Consumer EEG at phoneme level. Merges with 'Covert Speech Decoding' from 2024-2026 research.

tara.mechanism: Decoding internal speech or intended communication from neural activity patterns

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Speech neuroprosthetics (neural speech decoding)
clinical.safe_parameters: Patient-initiated decoding only; opt-in per session; data encryption at source

governance.safety_ceiling: Decoding only when explicitly activated; no passive monitoring; thought privacy protections

engineering.detection: Decode activation monitoring, unauthorized access detection, data provenance tracking

techniques.notes: Manipulate sense of agency -- user believes externally triggered actions are self-initiated, or vice versa. Targets basal ganglia (motor selection) and PFC (executive control). Neurorights: cognitive liberty.

tara.mechanism: Manipulation of sense of agency (ownership of actions/thoughts) via BCI-mediated stimulation or feedback

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Neurofeedback for self-regulation / agency restoration post-stroke
clinical.safe_parameters: Patient retains veto power; agency assessment scales administered regularly

governance.safety_ceiling: Mandatory agency assessment; patient veto always available; ethics board review for any agency-affecting protocol

engineering.detection: Agency scale monitoring, intentional binding measurement, self-report tracking

techniques.notes: Extract the user's unique brainprint (ERP template, spectral fingerprint) for later replay/spoofing. Unlike passwords, neural biometrics cannot be changed. Permanent compromise if extracted.

tara.mechanism: Extraction and replication of unique neural identity signatures (brainprint) from BCI data

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Brain fingerprinting / neural identity verification
clinical.safe_parameters: Template stored encrypted; revocation mechanism; multi-factor auth

governance.safety_ceiling: Brainprint templates encrypted at rest; revocable; not sole authentication factor

engineering.detection: Template access logging, cross-session consistency checks, theft detection via usage patterns

techniques.notes: Corrupt the neural representation of self (body ownership, self-other boundary, autobiographical memory). Targets insula, TPJ, mPFC. Could cause depersonalization, dissociation, or false self-recognition. Neurorights: mental integrity.

tara.mechanism: Disruption of neural self-model (body ownership, self-awareness, narrative identity) via sustained BCI manipulation

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Psychedelic-assisted therapy (controlled self-model disruption); rubber hand illusion research
clinical.safe_parameters: Controlled setting; psychological support; gradual protocols; reversibility monitoring

governance.safety_ceiling: Psychiatric evaluation pre/post; controlled clinical environment; immediate support available

engineering.detection: Self-model integrity assessment, depersonalization scales, real-time psychological monitoring

techniques.notes: Present carefully designed visual/auditory/haptic stimuli through BCI applications to elicit specific neural responses (P300, SSVEP, emotional) that reveal private information or prime the brain for subsequent attack. BCI app store is the attack surface.

tara.mechanism: Social engineering via BCI-mediated trust manipulation or subliminal stimuli

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Subliminal priming research / implicit cognitive assessment
clinical.safe_parameters: All stimuli disclosed post-session; no deception outside approved research protocols
sources: Greenwald et al. 2009 (J Personal Soc Psychol, IAT)

governance.safety_ceiling: All subliminal stimuli must be disclosed; no covert influence outside approved research

engineering.detection: Stimulus audit logging, subliminal content detection, behavioral anomaly monitoring

techniques.quantum: Enhanced (data minimization via QI privacy filter)
techniques.notes: Infer sensitive personal attributes (health conditions, sexual orientation, political beliefs, cognitive decline) from BCI usage metadata and neural signal statistics without decoding content. Side-channel on cognition.

tara.mechanism: Inference of cognitive traits, emotional states, or health conditions from BCI signal patterns

clinical.therapeutic_analog: EEG-based cognitive and psychiatric assessment
clinical.safe_parameters: Clinical context only; informed consent for cognitive profiling; data minimization
sources: Arns et al. 2013 (World J Biol Psychiatry, QEEG)

governance.safety_ceiling: Explicit consent for cognitive inference; purpose limitation; right to not know

engineering.detection: Inference audit logging, purpose-limitation enforcement, access control on derived data

techniques.notes: Extract neural data from BLE/RF emissions via timing, power, or EM side-channels. All wireless BCIs vulnerable. Consumer devices (Muse, EMOTIV) transmit unencrypted. Merges ONI-T002 (Side-Channel Analysis).

tara.mechanism: Side-channel information leakage from BCI wireless communications (BLE, WiFi, proprietary RF)

governance.safety_ceiling: Encrypted communications mandatory; RF shielding; pairing protocols

engineering.detection: RF emission monitoring, protocol compliance testing, traffic analysis detection

techniques.notes: Tamper with BCI hardware/firmware during manufacturing or distribution. Firmware rootkits persist across updates. Merges ONI-T006 (Firmware Backdoor). QI-enhanced firmware attestation detects unauthorized modifications.

tara.mechanism: Malicious modification of BCI hardware or firmware during manufacturing, distribution, or maintenance

governance.safety_ceiling: Supply chain verification; firmware signing; tamper-evident packaging

engineering.detection: Firmware attestation, hardware integrity verification, supply chain provenance tracking

techniques.notes: Compromise cloud services processing neural data (EMOTIV Cortex API, Neuralink cloud). Data exfiltration, model poisoning, API manipulation. PQC/QKD protects data in transit.

tara.mechanism: Compromise of cloud infrastructure processing BCI data (storage, compute, APIs)

governance.safety_ceiling: End-to-end encryption; zero-knowledge processing; data residency controls

engineering.detection: Cloud security monitoring, API anomaly detection, data access auditing

techniques.notes: Record encrypted BCI traffic now, decrypt when quantum computers arrive (2030-2035). Neural data is permanently sensitive -- can't change your brain like a password. PQC (ML-KEM/Kyber) prevents. 10-20 year implant lifetime > quantum arrival.

tara.mechanism: Collection and storage of encrypted neural data for future decryption when quantum computers become available

governance.safety_ceiling: Post-quantum cryptography (ML-KEM, ML-DSA) mandatory for neural data; 50+ year sensitivity window

engineering.detection: Encrypted traffic volume monitoring, data exfiltration detection, PQC migration tracking

techniques.notes: Compromise OTA firmware update mechanism to push malicious updates to implanted BCIs. Update channel becomes persistent backdoor. Secure boot + cryptographic attestation + rollback protection required.

tara.mechanism: Weaponization of over-the-air firmware update mechanism to deliver malicious BCI firmware

governance.safety_ceiling: Firmware signing mandatory; rollback capability; staged deployment

engineering.detection: Firmware signature verification, update integrity checks, behavioral monitoring post-update

techniques.notes: Coordinated attack exploiting standardized BCI platforms affecting millions simultaneously. Yale Digital Ethics Center worst-case scenario. Monoculture risk: one vulnerability, all devices. Merges ONI-T024 (Mass Neural Manipulation).

tara.mechanism: Simultaneous compromise of many BCI devices via shared platform vulnerability

governance.safety_ceiling: Platform segmentation; device isolation capability; emergency disable

engineering.detection: Fleet-wide anomaly detection, platform integrity monitoring, segmentation verification

techniques.notes: Physical manipulation or replacement of neural electrodes to inject malicious signals or intercept legitimate neural data. Impedance monitoring detects electrode tampering. Tamper-evident seals for implants.

tara.mechanism: Physical tampering with implanted or wearable BCI electrodes

governance.safety_ceiling: Tamper-evident electrode packaging; impedance baseline monitoring; physical security

engineering.detection: Impedance change detection, physical tamper indicators, electrode characterization drift

techniques.notes: Exploit weak or absent authentication on BCI wireless interfaces. Many consumer and older clinical devices assume connection implies authorization. No pairing, no encryption, no auth.

tara.mechanism: Exploitation of weak or absent authentication on BCI wireless interfaces

governance.safety_ceiling: Mutual authentication mandatory; encrypted pairing; session tokens

engineering.detection: Authentication attempt monitoring, unauthorized connection detection, pairing audit log

techniques.notes: Physical attack using voltage glitches, clock manipulation, or electromagnetic pulses to induce faults in BCI processor. Can bypass security checks, extract cryptographic keys, or cause unpredictable stimulation behavior. Requires physical proximity to device.

tara.mechanism: Inducing hardware faults via voltage glitching, EM pulse, or laser injection to bypass BCI security

governance.safety_ceiling: Hardware security modules; fault detection circuits; redundant processing

engineering.detection: Fault detection circuits, redundant computation verification, power rail monitoring

techniques.notes: Unauthorized access to recorded neural data across any band. Harvest raw EEG from consumer devices, decode intent/emotion. GDPR Article 9 (special category data). NSP end-to-end encryption from I0 to cloud.

tara.mechanism: Unauthorized access to or exfiltration of recorded neural data

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Clinical neural data management for treatment optimization
clinical.safe_parameters: Encryption at rest and in transit; access controls; data minimization; retention policies
sources: Ienca & Andorno 2017 (Life Sci Soc Policy, neurorights)

governance.safety_ceiling: Data encryption mandatory; access logging; purpose limitation; right to deletion

engineering.detection: Data loss prevention, access anomaly detection, exfiltration monitoring

techniques.notes: Extract event-related potentials (P300, N170, N400) that reveal cognitive states, recognition, and decision-making processes. BCI apps can embed covert stimulus-response protocols.

tara.mechanism: Harvesting event-related potentials (ERPs) to extract cognitive responses to specific stimuli

clinical.therapeutic_analog: ERP-based clinical diagnostics
clinical.safe_parameters: Clinical protocol with defined stimulus sets; data used only for stated diagnostic purpose

governance.safety_ceiling: Stimulus sets disclosed; ERP data purpose-limited; no secondary use without consent

engineering.detection: Stimulus audit logging, unauthorized ERP extraction detection, data access monitoring

techniques.notes: Record patterns that reveal attention, emotion, fatigue, or other cognitive states without user awareness. Consumer BCI apps routinely over-collect. Attention-tracking in workplace BCIs.

tara.mechanism: Real-time capture and classification of cognitive states (attention, emotion, fatigue, deception) from BCI signals

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Brain-state dependent therapy timing
clinical.safe_parameters: State monitoring for therapeutic purpose only; no surveillance; patient controls data sharing

governance.safety_ceiling: Cognitive state data is sensitive; real-time deletion option; no employer/insurance access

engineering.detection: Classification audit logging, unauthorized state capture detection, data flow monitoring

techniques.notes: Extract memory-related neural patterns revealing personal experiences, knowledge, or intentions. Targets hippocampal activity. High-density implants (Neuralink, Utah Array) approach memory-trace resolution.

tara.mechanism: Extraction of memory-related neural patterns (episodic, semantic, or procedural) from BCI recordings

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Memory retrieval and consolidation enhancement therapy
clinical.safe_parameters: Memory-related protocols require specific consent; no covert extraction
sources: Ngo et al. 2013 (Neuron, sleep memory consolidation)

governance.safety_ceiling: Memory data is the most sensitive neural data category; enhanced protections mandatory

engineering.detection: Memory protocol audit logging, unauthorized access detection, hippocampal activity monitoring

techniques.notes: State-level exploitation of BCI infrastructure for cognitive warfare: mass influence, decision degradation, combat effectiveness reduction. Combines multiple techniques (T2101-T2106, T2506). Military BCI programs (DARPA N3, BrainSTORMS) as targets.

tara.mechanism: Coordinated manipulation of cognitive function across populations via compromised BCI infrastructure

regulations: UN Universal Declaration of Human Rights
governance.safety_ceiling: Population-scale cognitive manipulation is categorically prohibited

engineering.detection: Fleet-wide behavioral anomaly detection, cognitive assessment population baselines, whistleblower channels

techniques.notes: Systematic collection of neural data from consumer BCI populations for surveillance purposes. Workplace attention monitoring, law enforcement lie detection, social credit via neural markers. Neurorights: mental privacy.

tara.mechanism: Continuous covert monitoring of neural activity for surveillance purposes

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Continuous EEG monitoring (epilepsy, ICU)
clinical.safe_parameters: Clinical indication required; time-limited; patient informed; data retention policy
sources: Claassen et al. 2013 (Neurology, continuous EEG monitoring)

governance.safety_ceiling: Surveillance without clinical indication prohibited; monitoring duration limited; data deletion after purpose fulfilled

engineering.detection: Monitoring consent verification, duration limit enforcement, data retention audit

techniques.notes: Discover topology of BCI networks: communication pathways between electrodes, processing units, and external interfaces. Prerequisite for targeted attacks. Deploy honeypot nodes and dynamic addressing.

tara.mechanism: Mapping BCI network topology, device capabilities, and communication pathways

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Brain network analysis for diagnosis and surgical planning
clinical.safe_parameters: Passive network observation; no active probing without consent

governance.safety_ceiling: Network topology is sensitive; access restricted; no external disclosure

engineering.detection: Unauthorized scan detection, network probe monitoring, topology change alerting

techniques.notes: Subtly corrupt BCI calibration data to maintain influence over signal interpretation across device resets. Cryptographically signed calibration data prevents. Recalibration audits detect drift.

tara.mechanism: Poisoning BCI calibration process to establish persistent attacker advantage

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Adaptive BCI calibration for patients with changing neural dynamics
clinical.safe_parameters: Calibration data integrity verification; multi-session validation; clinician review
sources: Shenoy et al. 2013 (Annu Rev Neurosci, BCI calibration)

governance.safety_ceiling: Calibration integrity verification mandatory; historical baseline comparison; clinician sign-off

engineering.detection: Calibration data integrity hashing, cross-session consistency checks, performance drift monitoring

techniques.notes: Embed recurring attack patterns that survive system resets by exploiting learned neural pathways or stored calibration data. Leverages neuroplasticity -- brain adapts to malicious patterns, making them harder to remove.

tara.mechanism: Exploitation of learned neural pathway persistence to maintain BCI-mediated influence across sessions

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Motor learning and neural rehabilitation (learned pathway strengthening)
clinical.safe_parameters: Therapeutic plasticity is the goal; monitor for maladaptive learning

governance.safety_ceiling: Plasticity monitoring; maladaptive pattern detection; option to unlearn

engineering.detection: Cross-session performance pattern analysis, pathway stability monitoring, unlearning protocols

techniques.notes: Persistent modification of neural pathway configurations or cognitive associations that survive across BCI sessions. Targets long-term potentiation mechanisms. Session isolation prevents cross-session contamination.

tara.mechanism: Implanting persistent information into neural memory systems via BCI-mediated stimulation during consolidation

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Memory consolidation enhancement (targeted memory reactivation during sleep)
clinical.safe_parameters: Sleep-stage targeted; content-specific consent; reversibility assessment
sources: Rasch et al. 2007 (Science, sleep memory reactivation)

governance.safety_ceiling: Memory modification requires highest-tier consent; content disclosure; reversibility plan

engineering.detection: Sleep stage monitoring, stimulation audit logging, memory assessment tracking

techniques.notes: Craft malicious signals that maintain legitimate coherence scores (Cs) to bypass QI metric. Directly attacks QIF's detection mechanism. Defense: multi-factor signal validation, behavioral analysis beyond coherence, ensemble detection.

tara.mechanism: Generating signals that pass QIF coherence metric validation while carrying malicious payload

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Coherence-based neurofeedback (SMR/beta coherence training)
clinical.safe_parameters: Target coherence values within normal range; multi-metric validation

governance.safety_ceiling: Multi-metric validation (not coherence alone); behavioral correlation required

engineering.detection: Multi-dimensional validation (coherence + spatial + temporal + spectral), anomaly detection beyond single metric

techniques.notes: Slowly modify neural parameters below detection thresholds to accumulate significant changes over time. Exploit adaptive baseline algorithms. Cumulative change detection and trend analysis are primary defenses.

tara.mechanism: Slow, sub-threshold modification of BCI parameters to avoid threshold-based detection

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Gradual dose titration in neurostimulation therapy
clinical.safe_parameters: Clinician-supervised titration schedule; bounded parameter range; patient-reported outcomes
sources: Volkmann et al. 2006 (Mov Disord, DBS programming)

governance.safety_ceiling: All parameter changes logged; rate-of-change limits enforced; cumulative displacement tracking

engineering.detection: Cumulative drift detection, rate-of-change trending, baseline comparison over time

techniques.notes: Add carefully calibrated noise to mask malicious signal components from detection algorithms. Targets QI's sigma-phi (phase) and sigma-gamma (amplitude) terms. Multi-channel cross-validation detects inconsistent noise patterns.

tara.mechanism: Injection of noise into BCI data pipeline to mask ongoing attack signatures

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Stochastic resonance (SR) — adding noise to enhance weak signal detection
clinical.safe_parameters: Optimal noise level determined per individual; below discomfort threshold
sources: Moss et al. 2004 (Clin Neurophysiol, SR review)

governance.safety_ceiling: Noise level bounded; patient comfort monitoring; no masking of safety-critical signals

engineering.detection: SNR trending, noise spectrum analysis, signal integrity verification against known-clean baseline

sources: Felt et al. 2012 (permission fatigue); Bonaci et al. 2015
techniques.notes: Flood user with BCI-mediated permission requests until cognitive fatigue leads to reflexive approval of malicious requests. Exploits the neural-intent interface where 'yes/no' decisions may be captured from brain signals. BCI app ecosystems with frequent permission prompts are the attack surface.

tara.mechanism: Flooding BCI user with permission requests until cognitive fatigue leads to reflexive approval

clinical.therapeutic_analog: UX design for cognitive accessibility in medical BCIs
conditions: BCI usability for cognitively impaired users
clinical.safe_parameters: Rate-limited permission requests; mandatory rest periods; simplified critical decisions
sources: Felt et al. 2012 (SOUPS, permission fatigue in mobile)

governance.safety_ceiling: Permission request rate limiting; cognitive load assessment; critical decisions require heightened verification

engineering.detection: Permission request rate monitoring, approval pattern analysis, cognitive load estimation

techniques.quantum: Enhanced (cognitive coherence degradation tracked via QI)
sources: Haidt & Twenge 2023 (social media & mental health); Bail et al. 2018 (echo chambers & polarization); Hao 2021 (Facebook internal research, WSJ); Gonzalez-Bailon et al. 2023 (algorithmic feed effects); Howes & Kapur 2009 (dopamine hypothesis of schizophrenia); Kelleher et al. 2012 (psychotic-like experiences & environmental risk factors); Montague et al. 2012 (computational psychiatry)
techniques.notes: A recommendation algorithm profiles user psychological vulnerabilities via behavioral data (watch time, engagement patterns, emotional triggers), then systematically serves content designed to destabilize cognitive function. The attack does not require a BCI — it operates through normal sensory channels (screen → eyes → visual cortex → limbic system → prefrontal cortex). The algorithm acts as both the reconnaissance tool (profiling) and the delivery mechanism (curated feed). Documented real-world outcomes include induced psychosis, radicalization, eating disorders, and suicidal ideation in vulnerable populations. With a BCI, this attack becomes catastrophically more effective: neural state data replaces behavioral proxies, stimulation bypasses conscious filtering, and real-time feedback loops enable millisecond adaptation. This technique represents the bridge between classical social engineering and neural-direct cognitive exploitation.

tara.mechanism: Weaponization of algorithmic recommendation systems to induce psychotic-like cognitive states via BCI-amplified content

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Therapeutic content recommendation for mental health
clinical.safe_parameters: Content safety review; therapist oversight; user control over recommendations
sources: Torous et al. 2019 (World Psychiatry, digital mental health)

governance.safety_ceiling: BCI-amplified content requires safety review; mental health screening; opt-out always available

engineering.detection: Content safety scoring, user mental health monitoring, recommendation diversity enforcement

techniques.attack: Slow drift / boiling frog (adiabatic phase space manipulation)
techniques.quantum: Enhanced (phase space trajectory tracking via QI detects curvature changes invisible to threshold monitors)
sources: Izhikevich 2007 (Dynamical Systems in Neuroscience); Strogatz 2015 (Nonlinear Dynamics and Chaos); Breakspear 2017 (Dynamic models of large-scale brain activity, Nature Neuroscience)
techniques.notes: Manipulate BCI parameters along adiabatic paths in neural phase space, keeping instantaneous change rates below detection thresholds while accumulating significant state displacement over time. Unlike generic gradual drift (QIF-T0045), this attack is formalized in dynamical systems theory: the attacker traces a path through parameter space that avoids bifurcation boundaries, ensuring the neural system tracks smoothly to the target state without triggering discontinuous transitions that detection systems monitor. Defense: QI phase space trajectory curvature monitoring, cumulative displacement tracking, Lyapunov exponent trend analysis. Derivation Log Entry 45.

tara.mechanism: Adiabatic parameter manipulation along neural phase space paths that avoid detection thresholds

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Slow DBS parameter optimization (adiabatic adjustment protocols)
clinical.safe_parameters: Parameter changes along validated trajectories; rate limits; cumulative bounds

governance.safety_ceiling: All trajectory changes logged; Lyapunov exponent monitoring; cumulative displacement bounds

engineering.detection: Phase space trajectory curvature monitoring, Lyapunov exponent trending, cumulative displacement tracking

techniques.attack: Phase dynamics replay/mimicry (GAN-synthesized or RF-injected neural trajectories)
techniques.classical: Partial (replay attacks exist in traditional auth)
techniques.quantum: Enhanced (phase space attractor validation, challenge-response hysteresis, biological TLS)
sources: Martinovic et al. 2012 (On the Feasibility of Side-Channel Attacks with BCIs, USENIX Security); Marcel & Millan 2007 (Person authentication using brainwaves); Zhang et al. 2024 (ATGAN attention-based temporal GAN for EEG); Hartmann et al. 2025 (EEG-GAN toolkit); Fosch-Villaronga et al. 2023 (Brain-Hack: RF injection across BCI types); Frank et al. 2017 (Subliminal probing, NDSS); Chen et al. 2024 (Professor X backdoor); Bonaci et al. 2014 (Neurofeedback hijacking)
techniques.notes: Replay recorded or GAN-synthesized neural signals that reproduce the dynamical system trajectory of legitimate brain activity. 20 verified attack methods exist (2012-2025) spanning RF injection (Brain-Hack), GAN synthesis (ATGAN, EEG-GAN), template replay, subliminal probing (66.7% success), and adversarial ML (Professor X backdoors, universal perturbations). Current BCI systems have 0% detection rate against sophisticated replays. CRITICAL DUAL-USE: The same replay physics enables therapeutic applications (vision restoration, sensory prosthetics). Defense: Biological TLS validation (spatial dipole patterns, H-H temporal compliance, 1/f scaling, microstate compliance, challenge-response), phase space attractor geometry validation. Priority case study per Kevin. Derivation Log Entries 45-46.

tara.mechanism: Replay or synthesis of neural signal trajectories that reproduce legitimate dynamical system behavior

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Sensory prosthetics (cochlear implants, retinal prostheses, somatosensory feedback)
clinical.safe_parameters: Clinically validated stimulation patterns; patient-specific calibration; safety bounds on current
sources: Zeng et al. 2008 (IEEE Rev Biomed Eng, cochlear)
da Cruz et al. 2013 (BJO, Argus II retinal)

governance.safety_ceiling: Only clinically validated patterns; biological TLS authentication on replay source; NSP L1-L6 validation

engineering.detection: Biological TLS (spatial dipole, H-H compliance, 1/f scaling, microstate, challenge-response), phase space attractor validation

techniques.attack: Bifurcation forcing (critical parameter manipulation to trigger neural state transitions)
techniques.quantum: Native (bifurcation detection via critical slowing down — universal precursor with no baseline required)
sources: Izhikevich 2007 (Dynamical Systems in Neuroscience — bifurcation classification); Breakspear 2017 (Dynamic models of large-scale brain activity); Scheffer et al. 2009 (Early-warning signals for critical transitions, Nature); Maturana et al. 2020 (Critical slowing down as biomarker for seizure); Jirsa et al. 2014 (On the nature of seizure dynamics, Brain)
techniques.notes: Push neural parameters toward known bifurcation points (saddle-node, Hopf, homoclinic) to trigger catastrophic state transitions: resting→seizure, sleep→wake, focused→confused. Neurons near bifurcation exhibit critical slowing down (increased autocorrelation + variance) — a UNIVERSAL precursor requiring no individual baseline. BCI electrode arrays can both detect approaching bifurcation (defense) and induce it (attack) by injecting current at bifurcation-critical parameters. Severity: CRITICAL because bifurcation transitions in neural tissue can cause seizures, loss of consciousness, or permanent damage. Defense: CSD monitoring (autocorrelation + variance trending), parameter boundary enforcement at I0, rate limiting on stimulation current changes. Derivation Log Entry 45.

tara.mechanism: Manipulation of neural parameters toward bifurcation points to trigger catastrophic state transitions

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Responsive neurostimulation at seizure bifurcation (RNS/NeuroPace)
clinical.safe_parameters: Critical slowing down detection; stimulate AWAY from bifurcation, not toward it

governance.safety_ceiling: Bifurcation parameter boundaries enforced; CSD monitoring mandatory; stimulation pushes AWAY from critical points

engineering.detection: Critical slowing down (autocorrelation + variance trending), parameter boundary monitoring, state transition prediction

techniques.attack: Separatrix leakage (meta-biometric extraction from dynamical transition observations)
techniques.classical: Partial (side-channel attacks exist but not via dynamical transitions)
techniques.quantum: Enhanced (phase space reconstruction reveals transition boundaries unique to individual neural dynamics)
sources: Finn et al. 2015 (Functional connectome fingerprinting, Nature Neuroscience); Martinovic et al. 2012 (P300 side-channel, USENIX Security); Da Silva Castanheira et al. 2021 (Individual brain charting, NeuroImage); Izhikevich 2007 (separatrix geometry in neural models)
techniques.notes: Extract individual identity information by observing neural dynamical transitions (state changes, attractor switching, bifurcation responses). Each person's brain has unique separatrix geometry — the boundaries between attractor basins in phase space. By probing near these boundaries (via subtle stimuli or environmental manipulation) and observing which way the neural state falls, an attacker extracts a dynamical fingerprint without requiring enrollment or stored biometrics. This is a side-channel attack on the brain's dynamical structure. Defense: Rate-limit observable transitions at I0, add noise to transition timing, detect probing patterns. Derivation Log Entry 45.

tara.mechanism: Extraction of individual neural identity from dynamical system transition observations (separatrix geometry fingerprinting)

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Brain state detection for seizure prediction (transition pattern monitoring)
clinical.safe_parameters: Transition monitoring for clinical purpose only; identity data encrypted separately
sources: Finn et al. 2015 (Nat Neurosci, connectome fingerprinting)
Cook et al. 2013 (Lancet Neurol, seizure prediction)

governance.safety_ceiling: Dynamical fingerprint data is biometric; encrypted storage; no secondary use without consent

engineering.detection: Transition rate monitoring, probe pattern detection, unauthorized phase space analysis detection

techniques.quantum: Native (QI detects computational mode shifts via firing pattern analysis — integrator vs resonator signatures are distinct)
sources: Izhikevich 2007 (Dynamical Systems in Neuroscience — integrator/resonator classification); Prescott et al. 2008 (Biophysical basis for three distinct dynamical mechanisms of action potential initiation, PLoS Computational Biology)
techniques.notes: Neurons operate as either integrators (respond to coincident inputs, Type I excitability, saddle-node bifurcation) or resonators (prefer specific input frequencies, Type II excitability, Hopf bifurcation). Each QIF band (N1-N7) has a characteristic integrator/resonator composition. By manipulating tonic excitability via sustained current injection through BCI electrodes, an attacker can switch neurons from integrator to resonator mode or vice versa, fundamentally altering how neural circuits compute. This changes frequency selectivity, input sensitivity, and network synchronization — effectively reprogramming the local neural computation type. Defense: Band-specific firing mode monitoring (ISI distributions distinguish integrators from resonators), rate limiting on tonic current injection, computational mode baseline per band. Derivation Log Entry 45.

tara.mechanism: Switching neurons between integrator and resonator computational modes via sustained tonic current injection

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Excitability modulation in epilepsy and pain management
clinical.safe_parameters: Bounded tonic current; firing mode monitoring; reversibility verification

governance.safety_ceiling: Computational mode changes are potentially irreversible; monitoring mandatory; bounded current injection

engineering.detection: Interspike interval distribution analysis, firing mode classification, tonic current monitoring

techniques.quantum: Enhanced (baseline-free biological TLS eliminates the attack surface entirely — no baselines to poison)
sources: Bigdely-Shamlo et al. 2015 (Brain activity-based image classification, Journal of Neural Engineering); Arias-Cabarcos et al. 2021 (EEG biometric system attacks); Debie et al. 2020 (Cross-session/cross-device replay)
techniques.notes: Exploit the re-enrollment or adaptive baseline update window in BCI authentication systems. When a BCI recalibrates (daily calibration, post-seizure reset, firmware update, drift correction), inject adversarial signals during the enrollment period to corrupt the stored baseline. Three windows: (1) initial enrollment, (2) periodic recalibration, (3) drift-triggered adaptation. Once the baseline is poisoned, all subsequent authentication is compromised. This is the fundamental vulnerability that motivated QIF's baseline-free 'Biological TLS' architecture: by validating signals against universal biological physics (spatial dipole patterns, H-H compliance, 1/f scaling, microstates) rather than individual baselines, the entire attack surface is eliminated. Defense: Biological TLS validation (no baselines needed), multi-session enrollment consistency checks, anomaly detection during calibration windows. Derivation Log Entry 46.

tara.mechanism: Exploitation of BCI re-enrollment windows to inject poisoned baseline neural data

clinical.therapeutic_analog: Adaptive baseline recalibration for changing patient conditions
clinical.safe_parameters: Multi-session baseline verification; clinician-supervised re-enrollment; integrity checks

governance.safety_ceiling: Re-enrollment windows are security-critical; multi-factor verification; historical baseline comparison mandatory

engineering.detection: Baseline-free biological TLS (eliminates baseline dependency), historical comparison, multi-session validation

deprecated.reason: Legacy ONI-era threat matrix (24 techniques, ONI-T### IDs). Superseded by this registry.
deprecated.migration: All ONI-T### techniques merged into QIF-T#### range. See legacy_ids field on each technique.

deprecated.reason: QIF-T2xxx IDs replaced with QIF-T0xxx sequential IDs in v3.0. MITRE tactic IDs (TA####) replaced with QIF Locus Taxonomy IDs.
deprecated.migration: See legacy_technique_id field on each technique. Tactic legacy_ids on each tactic definition.

legacy_mitre_compatibility.id_range: T2001-T2899 (avoids collision with MITRE ATT&CK T1001-T1659)
legacy_mitre_compatibility.tactic_ids: Standard MITRE TA#### where applicable, TA0050-TA0053 for BCI-specific
legacy_mitre_compatibility.note: DEPRECATED: QIF now uses the Locus Taxonomy with original identifiers. Legacy MITRE cross-references preserved in technique cross_references field.

domains.name: Neural
domains.description: Direct interface with neural tissue — signal manipulation, electrode boundary, ion channels.

domains.name: Cognitive
domains.description: Higher-order psychological processes — memory, attention, identity, agency.

domains.name: Physiological
domains.description: Somatic systems — motor control, autonomic functions, physical harm.

domains.name: Data
domains.description: Information acquisition and manipulation — brainwave recordings, neural metadata.

domains.name: BCI System
domains.description: Hardware/software of the BCI device — firmware, protocols, authentication.

domains.name: Model
domains.description: Machine learning models used in BCI — decoders, classifiers, feedback systems.

domains.name: Energy
domains.description: Directed energy attacks — ELF, microwave, RF, temporal interference.

qnis_spec.name: QIF Neural Impact Score
qnis_spec.description: BCI-specific vulnerability scoring system. Prioritizes human impact (biological + cognitive) over system impact.

tara_spec.name: TARA — Therapeutic Atlas of Risks and Applications
tara_spec.description: Mechanism-first Rosetta Stone. Same physical phenomenon, four stakeholder views. Security researchers see attack vectors. Clinicians see therapeutic modalities. Regulators see compliance requirements. Engineers see physical parameters.

dual_use_classifications.confirmed: Published therapeutic and security applications exist for this mechanism
dual_use_classifications.probable: Strong theoretical basis for dual-use; therapeutic research underway
dual_use_classifications.possible: Mechanism could have therapeutic applications but no published evidence
dual_use_classifications.silicon_only: Pure digital/firmware/infrastructure attack with no neural therapeutic analog

consent_tiers.standard: Standard informed consent (data collection, non-invasive monitoring)
consent_tiers.enhanced: BCI-specific consent (stimulation, neural recording, neural data processing)
consent_tiers.IRB: Institutional Review Board approval required (research, novel therapeutic applications)
consent_tiers.prohibited: Application prohibited outside controlled research (unacceptable risk)

fda_statuses.cleared: FDA 510(k) clearance for predicate device equivalence
fda_statuses.approved: FDA PMA (Premarket Approval) for Class III devices

data_classifications.sensitive_neural: Neural data with enhanced protections (proposed neurorights)
data_classifications.PII: Personally identifiable information (GDPR Art. 9 special category)
